parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To make clear (visible, manifest), make known. From phaneros; to render apparent.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
A letter, dispatch, epistle, message. From epistello; a written message.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Feminine Singular
str2: From diakonos; to be an attendant, i.e. Wait upon (figuratively) teacher; technically, to act as a Christian deacon.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Feminine Singular
str2: To write, inscribe. From en and grapho; to 'engrave', i.e. Inscribe.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
Ink. Neuter of melas as noun; ink.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.
Wind, breath, spirit.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: To live, be alive. A primary verb; to live.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
A tablet, flat surface. From plasso; a moulding-board, i.e. Flat surface.
Made of stone. From lithos; stony, i.e. Made of stone.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
A tablet, flat surface. From plasso; a moulding-board, i.e. Flat surface.
Fleshly, consisting of flesh, carnal. From sarx; similar to flesh, i.e. soft.
Prolonged from a primary kar; the heart, i.e. the thoughts or feelings; also the middle.
